articles.author: PAUL J. WEBER and JUAN A. LOZANO
articles.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — Republican Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton was fully acquitted Saturday of corruption charges in a historic impeachment trial, a resounding verdict that reaffirms the power of the GOP's hard right and puts an indicted incumbent who remains under FBI investigation back into office.
articles.title: Republican Texas AG Ken Paxton is acquitted of corruption charges at historic impeachment trial

articles.author: ROBERT F. BUKATY and DAVID SHARP
articles.description: BAR HARBOR, Maine (AP) — Atlantic storm Lee pummeled a large swath of New England and Maritime Canada with destructive winds, rough surf and torrential rains that toppled trees, flooded roadways and cut power to tens of thousands on Saturday.
articles.title: Thousands without power and 1 dead after Atlantic storm Lee pummels New England and Maritime Canada

articles.author: KIM TONG-HYUNG and HYUNG-JIN KIM
articles.description: SEOUL, South Korea (AP) — A day after inspecting Russia’s nuclear-capable bombers and other advanced weapons, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un on Sunday continued a trip to Russia's Far East with a visit to a university in Vladivostok, while his state media back home reported on his efforts to expand military cooperation with Moscow.
articles.title: North Korea's Kim visits university in Vladivostok as state media reports on arms talks with Moscow

articles.author: DAVID KOENIG
articles.description: DALLAS (AP) — Car shoppers are heading for a new round of sticker shock if the strike by the United Auto Workers doesn’t end soon, particularly for popular vehicles that are already in short supply.
articles.title: The auto workers strike will drive up car prices, but not right away — unless consumers panic

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT and THOMAS BEAUMONT
articles.description: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) — Hoping to cut into Donald Trump's support at a major Iowa gathering of evangelical Christians, several of his top rivals on Saturday mostly avoided direct criticism of him on abortion and other issues key to social conservatives.
articles.title: Donald Trump's GOP rivals try to attract social conservatives in Iowa at an event he skipped

articles.author: TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In the months since a single senator froze military promotions over the Pentagon’s abortion policy, the uniformed officers affected have been largely silent, wary of stepping into a political fray.
articles.title: Military officers begin to speak out on the harm done by Sen. Tuberville's holds on promotions

articles.author: SAM METZ and MOSA'AB EL SHAMY
articles.description: AMIZMIZ, Morocco (AP) — With their arms around each other, three boys walked through the streets of their town at the foot of Morocco’s Atlas Mountains.It could have been a scene like millions around the world that day.
articles.title: AP PHOTOS: Moroccan earthquake shattered thousands of lives

articles.author: HANNA ARHIROVA
articles.description: KRAMATORSK, Ukraine (AP) — In a basement in one of the front-line cities in Ukraine's Donetsk region, people gather three times a week in the morning for yoga to alleviate the stress caused by the constant shelling from Russian artillery.
articles.title: Yoga in a basement helps people in a Ukrainian front-line city cope with Russia's constant shelling

articles.author: TOM MURPHY
articles.description: When she prescribes the popular weight-loss drug Wegovy, Dr. Angela Fitch sends patients on a quest she likens to “The Hunger Games."
articles.title: Supply problems and insurance issues make popular weight-loss drugs hard to get

articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN
articles.description: The heat is about to be turned up on fossil fuels, the United States and President Joe Biden.As a record-smashing and deadly hot summer draws to a close, the United Nations and the city that hosts it are focusing on climate change and the burning of coal, oil and natural gas that causes it.
articles.title: Special UN summit, protests, week of talk turn up heat on fossil fuels and global warming
